more.title: How the Skeleton of Mutapa Times is Based on Sarah Charlesworth's Work
more.description: Conceptual artist Sarah Charlesworth's 1979 study of how newspapers covered a solar eclipse inspired the framework behind The Mutapa Times.

more.title: Councils fail to account for funds after ZINARA’s ZWG358 million disbursement for road maintenance
more.description: The Zimbabwe National Road Administration (ZINARA) disbursed over ZWG350 million to local authorities for road maintenance in 2025, but the lack of accountability by some councils has raised concerns over the utilisation of the funds. This was revealed by ZINARA Chief Executive Officer Nkosinathi Ncube during an appearance before the Parliamentary Portfolio Committee on Transport [...]The post Councils fail to account for funds after ZINARA’s ZWG358 million disbursement for road maintenance appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Zimbabwe owes Valterra Platinum $100 million in unpaid export proceeds
more.description: Reuters South Africa’s Valterra Platinum (VALJ.J), said on Wednesday it is owed $100 million in 2025 export proceeds by Zimbabwe’s government, which has started making some payments to clear the arrears. Zimbabwe requires all exporters to retain only 70% of their proceeds in foreign currency, with the balance being converted to local currency. Valterra and [...]The post Zimbabwe owes Valterra Platinum $100 million in unpaid export proceeds appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Zimbabwe pushes manufacturers to use local raw materials under new strategy
more.description: Industry and Commerce Minister Dr Mangaliso Ndlovu has revealed that the government will soon roll out a Local Content Strategy aimed at promoting the use of locally manufactured raw materials in Zimbabwe’s manufacturing sector. The move comes as Zimbabwe continues to spend an estimated US$1.5 billion annually on industrial consumables, with basic imports such as [...]The post Zimbabwe pushes manufacturers to use local raw materials under new strategy appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: ZIMRA, Buy Zimbabwe in joint blitz to curb smuggling of goods
more.description: The Zimbabwe Revenue Authority (ZIMRA) and Buy Zimbabwe have intensified efforts to curb the smuggling of goods at various entry points, a practice identified as a major threat to local industry. Authorities in Zimbabwe have long struggled to combat the illegal importation of goods due to porous border posts and corruption. As a result, the [...]The post ZIMRA, Buy Zimbabwe in joint blitz to curb smuggling of goods appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Africa’s Critical Minerals Moment: Why Zimbabwe’s Lithium Export Ban Signals a Continental Industrial Pivot
more.description: When Zimbabwe announced an immediate suspension on the export of raw lithium and other unprocessed minerals in late February 2026, the reaction was swift. Market traditionalists warned of distortion. Traders predicted supply disruptions. Some framed the move as economic nationalism. Yet to interpret Zimbabwe’s decision in isolation is to miss the structural shift underway across [...]The post Africa’s Critical Minerals Moment: Why Zimbabwe’s Lithium Export Ban Signals a Continental Industrial Pivot appeared first on The Zimbabwe Mail.

more.title: Econet to Delist from ZSE as Masiyiwa Unveils US$3 Billion AI and Infrastructure Vision
more.description: HARARE – Shareholders of Econet Wireless Zimbabwe have voted to delist the telecommunications group from the Zimbabwe Stock Exchange (ZSE), drawing the curtain on a 26-year chapter as a publicly traded company and signalling a strategic pivot towards an ambitious US$3 billion technology and infrastructure expansion. The resolution was approved at an extraordinary general meeting in [...]The post Econet to Delist from ZSE as Masiyiwa Unveils US$3 Billion AI and Infrastructure Vision appeared first on The Zimbabwe Mail.

more.title: Brian Bennett’s Heroic Unbeaten 97 In Vain As India Eliminate Zimbabwe From T20 World Cup
more.description: Brian Bennett Smashes 97 Against India But Zimbabwe Bow Out Of T20 World Cup A sensational unbeaten knock of 97 runs from Zimbabwe’s young sensation Brian Bennett was the only shining light in an otherwise dominant performance by India, who crushed the Chevrons by 72 runs at the T20 World Cup to book their spot [...]The post Brian Bennett’s Heroic Unbeaten 97 In Vain As India Eliminate Zimbabwe From T20 World Cup appeared first on iHarare News.

more.description: Source: Tungwarara accepted into the Zanu-PF Central Committee – herald Joseph Madzimure Zimpapers Politics Hub The Politburo on Wednesday confirmed the cooption of Presidential Advisor, Paul Tungwarara, into the Central Committee for Manicaland province.
